title: Aquatics Full & Part Time Lifeguard and Swim Instructor Positions
description:
**HIRING IMMEDIATELY!**  

**Paid training, set shifts, no late nights, AND pay rate up to $20/hour\\***  

  

**We're looking for responsible, consistent and hard-working applicants who are invested in the progress of our students.**  

**Ideally we are looking for candidates for a consistent schedule of a minimum of 3 shifts per week.**  

  

**Schedule availability should include:**  

**at least one (1) weekday morning or afternoon**  

**at least one (1) weekend day**  

  

We have a mission to teach kids how to swim and be safer, in and around the water, while  

making each child's experience GOLDEN! We desire to maintain a “get it" mentality, a “want it”  

attitude, and the “capacity” to learn and grow professionally and personally.  

That is why we are always smiling!  

  

Our team is growing, and we are looking for team players who are enthusiastic, have a can-do  

attitude, and enjoy working with children. We provide paid on-the-job training, flexible  

scheduling, a rewarding work environment, and a one-of-a-kind culture that will make you part of a team!  

If you, or someone you know, wants to work in an environment where you can make a difference  

in the lives of children, apply today!  

  

**Job Title: Swim Instructor (Swim Teacher) and/or Lifeguard**  

**Summary: Instructs students on water safety and proper swim techniques based on a thorough**  

**knowledge of the Goldfish Swim School curriculum.**  

  

**Benefits**  

* Paid training
* Leadership roles available
* Flexible hours & great pay
* Valuable work experience and advancement opportunities exist for the right candidate
* Increased social opportunities
* Future references/referrals
* Referral Bonuses
* Free swim lessons to your immediate family (after 90 days of employment)
* Fun staff outings
* Hard work is rewarded with Snack Shack bonuses, gift cards, and other perks!

**Requirements**  

* Ability to work with children of all ages and ability levels
* Excellent interpersonal communication and organizational skills

**Duties and Responsibilities**  

* Provides swim instruction based on the Goldfish Swim School curriculum
* Enforces safety rules and regulations to prevent accidents.
* Lifeguard responsibilities and administers first aid when necessary
* Evaluates students’ progress, and completes required paperwork
* Interacts with parents/guardians on the activities and development of students’ swim skills
* Attends required/mandatory workshops and in-service training outside of regular working hours
* Fulfills other duties or responsibilities as assigned by the Employer

**Education/Experience:** 16+. Experience in child care, as a camp counselor, coach or mentor is a plus. A passion for kids, fitness, and the sport of swimming is important!  

  

**Certifications:** Not required. However we offer Lifeguard Classes for those candidates looking to lifeguard and wish to obtain/maintain current Lifeguard, CPR/AED, and First Aid certifications.  

  

**Compensation**: $16.00 - $20.00 per hour  

  

**Tropical Vibes & Impacting Lives!**  

You feel it the moment you walk in. There’s more than vibrant colors, a tropical theme and happy children. There’s something different, something extraordinary. Something truly GOLDEN. **It’s passion.** Not just a passion for kids or a passion for swimming…it’s a special passion for changing – even saving – lives, by being a part of kids learning to swim.  

  

When you work at Goldfish, you're not just an employee. You're a part of something bigger. You're making an impact; a splash in the lives of the children in your community. You're an integral part of a team, working together to move forward a mission. You’re also making waves in your future, learning life lessons in and out of the pool through mentorship, leadership and passion. At Goldfish, it’s more than a job - it’s an endless pool of possibilities, opportunities and life-changing moments!  

  

**Making Waves with Passion, Purpose & Core Values!**  

At Goldfish, our core values are at the heart of everything we do, and behind every decision that we make. To us, these values are more than just words - they're embraced with purpose in our everyday lives, and what allows us to make a splash in our community, and in the lives of our members and our team!  

  

We go above and beyond with every detail to create a **GOLDEN Experience!**  

We believe in nurturing a culture that provides **WOW! Customer Service**  

We do the right things, make the right decisions and treat people with **Integrity • Compassion • Trust**  

We meet and exceed expectations so you see **Extraordinary Results**  

We make a big deal about life’s accomplishments by remembering to **Celebrate!**  

If you, or someone you know, desires to work for a place where you can make a difference, explore, apply and then join us!  

  

Goldfish Swim School Wyckoff is a learn-to-swim facility for kids ages 4 months to 12 years. Our proven confidence-building curriculum promotes a love of swimming and teaches children to be safer in and around the water. For additional information see:  

http://www.goldfishswimschool.com/wyckoff  

  

NOTE: The information within this posting is not all-inclusive and may be subject to change. Employee to fulfill other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the Employer. Goldfish Swim School Wyckoff/Gramercy Place Partners LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  

  

*Each Goldfish Swim School is an independently owned and operated franchise. The respective Franchisee is the employer at each Goldfish Swim School location. Each franchisee can set their own wages, benefit programs and terms and conditions of employment, which may vary at each Goldfish Swim School location.*  

*Each Goldfish Swim School is an independently owned and operated franchise. The respective Franchisee is the employer at each Goldfish Swim School location. Each franchisee can set their own wages, benefit programs and terms and conditions of employment, which may vary at each Goldfish Swim School location.*

title: OR Orthopaedic Nurse
description:
**Hackensack Surgery Center - Let us be your career destination!**


**Calling all OR, Pre-Op and PACU Nurses**!



We are looking for a competent **Operating room nurse** to assist surgeons during orthopaedic procedures and keeping the operating room sterile at all times.



Candidates need to possess phenomenal efficiency and attention to detail with a strong knowledge of orthopaedic operational procedures and patient safety. Being compassionate and sensitive is a prerequisite for the profession. The ideal candidate goes one step further by being a critical thinker, fast to act in emergencies.



Are you energetic, yet highly focused and love working in a fast-paced, patient-centered environment? If so, apply today and join us at Hackensack Surgery Center.


**RN OR** - **Monday-Friday only. No weekends or nights.**


**Responsibilities:**


* Assess patients prior to surgery (e.g. NPO status) and alleviate their concerns
* Gather all supplies needed for the operation
* Assume responsibility of keeping the operating room sterilized
* Position and prepare patient on operating table
* Pass medical instruments or other objects to the surgeon during operation
* Monitor patient’s vital signs to detect anomalies
* Evaluate patient in postoperative phases
* Adhere to safety standards and precautions
* Assume duties within or out of the sterile field as assigned


The RN OR initiates the delivery of patient care through the framework of the nursing process (assessment, diagnosis, and patient outcome) in the preoperative, inter-operative, and postoperative phases of the surgical patient. Orthopaedic experience is preferred but not required for this role.


**Requirements and skills**
---------------------------


* Proven experience as orthopaedic operating room nurse (circulating and scrub)
* Excellent knowledge of aseptic and sterile techniques
* Solid understanding of patient safety and precautions
* In-depth knowledge of surgical operation procedures
* Outstanding organizational ability
* A great team player with excellent communication skills
* Cool tempered with emotional and physical stamina
* Diploma in nursing and a valid license


**Education / Experience:**  

* Graduate of an accredited school of nursing
* Current Registered Nurse License
* BLS, ACLS and PALS certifications

**Benefits**


* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance
* Health Savings Account with an employer contribution
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* 401(k) retirement plan with a company match
* And more!


 **Equal Employment Opportunity & Work Force Diversity**Our organization is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, creed, sex, religion, marital status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, parental status, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic testing results or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws. This practice relates to all personnel matters such as compensation, benefits, training, promotions, transfers, layoffs, etc. Furthermore, our organization is committed to going beyond the legal requirements of equal employment opportunity to take positive actions which ensure diversity in the workplace and result in a multi-cultural organization.

title: Care Coordinator/Front Desk -Murray Hill
description:
Care Coordinator/Front Desk –Murray Hill, Manhattan
  
Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is seeking a qualified, passionate Care Coordinator to join the team at our Murray Hill clinic in Midtown, Manhattan.
  
Care Coordinators are responsible for supporting patient care by making our patients feel welcomed and valued whilst also controlling the flow of the appointment. Care Coordinators are expected to respond to all phone calls and emails within 2 hours and always within 24hours. Care Coordinators will guide our patients through our out-of-network experience and greet all patients who enter the clinic with a smile. Care Coordinators are expected to execute 5-star customer service. Spear strives to foster a true community environment for both patients and team members; therefore, a collaborative spirit is valued to ensure everyone receives the care and support they need.
  
  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Previous customer service experience.
* Someone who is hospitable, welcoming, and team-orientated.
* Strong communication skills and ability to multi-task.
* A strong attention to detail and willingness to grow.
* BA.BS degree preferred, not required.


**WHAT WE OFFER:**  

We know that exceptional patient service can only be achieved when our team is well cared for.
  
We strive to create an environment that bolsters career growth while providing the flexibility and
  
time necessary to simply be a human being. Further benefits include:
  
* One Medical paid membership. Learn more at onemedical.com/business
* Mental Health benefits that include paid time off and support services through Journey Live & employer sponsored EAP program.
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits, Commuter FSA Plan.
* 401(K) Safe Harbor Match: SPEAR will make a matching contribution equal to 100% of the first 3% of annual compensation, plus 50% of the next 2% of annual compensation. The total SPEAR matching contribution will not exceed 4% of your annual compensation
* Generous paid time including PTO, Floating Holidays, Company Holidays, Mental Health
* Commuter FSA Plans – pretax savings plans for travel to & from work
* Employee Perks: discounted rates for entertainment, travel, fitness, insurance plans, etc. Gym membership discounts with Blink & Crunch Fitness.
* Company Events - Annual Summer Picnic and Holiday Awards Celebration


**SALARY:** $16 - $22 / hr
  
  

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**  

We value empathy in our team members and a dedication to clinical excellence -- whatever your workstyle -- above all else. While we are looking for both entrepreneurial big-thinkers and those dedicated simply to the day-to-day of treatment, successful candidates will understand that being clear is kind and that actions express priorities. No matter where you are in your career, we are positive you will find your niche with us and grow.
  
  

**Further success factors may include:**  

* Passion for the field hospitality and customer service.
* Self-motivation and willingness to go above and beyond.
* Enjoyment of seeking out an opportunity to make an impact daily and connecting with people.
* A proactive, collaborative, team-oriented attitude because we don’t work in silos.
* You celebrate wins and learn from losses with your patients, colleagues, and surrounding communities.
* A resonance with our SPEAR-IT values:
* Service
* Passion
* Empathy
* Accountability
* Respect
* Impact
* Teamwork


**ABOUT US:**  

Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is the nation’s leading outpatient practice. With more than 40 clinics in the New York Tri-State Area and 25 years of experience, Spear provides unprecedented patient access to physical and occupational therapy through its robust list of services covered by most major insurances. Since its founding, Spear has been honored by some of the top medical, academic, and business communities. Among these accolades, they have twice been named the nation’s top physical therapy practice by the American Physical Therapy Association and WebPT, received the Columbia Award for Leadership in Clinical Education, served as official therapists to Olympic teams and Broadway shows, and been featured for their expertise in The New York Times, CBS News, Good Morning America, The Today Show, and more. Learn more about Spear’s history of excellence at spearcenter.com.

title: Medical Receptionist
description:
Join our team at Dermatology Physicians of Connecticut as a Full Time Medical Receptionist in Norwalk! If you are a recent graduate looking to kickstart your career in the healthcare industry or looking to further your medical office experience, this role is perfect for you. You'll have the opportunity to work onsite, gaining hands-on experience in a fast-paced clinic environment.


As a key member of our team, you will interact with patients, assist with administrative tasks, and contribute to the overall efficiency of our practice. Your excellent communication skills and attention to detail will be essential in providing top-notch patient care. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to grow and learn in a supportive and professional setting.


You can get great benefits such as Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Paid Meals, and Employee Discounts. Are you ready to make a difference in patients' lives every day? Apply now!

### **LET US INTRODUCE OURSELVES**


Dermatology Physicians is a privately-owned dermatology practice with 10 locations. We are currently looking to expand our staff with a full-time receptionist. As a fast growing practice we also offer growth opportunities within the practice. We pride ourselves in putting our patients first and we are committed to providing top medical care for all of our patients.

### **DAY TO DAY AS A MEDICAL RECEPTIONIST**


As a Medical Receptionist at Dermatology Physicians of Connecticut in Norwalk, you will play a vital role in ensuring patients feel comfortable and welcome from the moment they walk through our doors. Your responsibilities will include greeting patients with a friendly smile, obtaining necessary insurance and demographic information accurately, answering phone calls promptly and professionally, scheduling appointments efficiently, triaging patient needs effectively, and processing payments with attention to detail. Your empathetic demeanor and strong organizational skills will be key in creating a positive and seamless experience for our patients, reflecting our commitment to high performance and patient-focused care.

### **ARE YOU THE MEDICAL RECEPTIONIST WE'RE LOOKING FOR?**


To excel as a Medical Receptionist at Dermatology Physicians of Connecticut, candidates must possess strong computer skills to navigate the software and tools essential for daily tasks. Proficiency in using computers for data entry, scheduling appointments, and processing payments is crucial. Organizational skills are also paramount in managing patient information accurately, maintaining appointment schedules, and prioritizing tasks effectively in a fast-paced clinic setting.


Attention to detail and the ability to multitask will be essential for success in this role, ensuring smooth operations and positive patient experiences. If you thrive in a professional and patient-focused environment and are adept at utilizing computer systems while staying organized, this opportunity is ideal for you.


Knowledge and skills required for the position are:

* Computer
* Organizational

### **CONNECT WITH OUR TEAM TODAY!**


If you think this job is a fit for what you are looking for, great! We're excited to meet you!

title: SVP, Product Management & Design
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**Your New Role...**

  

We are CNN. THE WORLD'S MOST ESSENTIAL AND ENGAGING SOURCE OF DIGITAL NEWS. We are in the midst of rapid transformation and need our next generation of innovators, makers, and dreamers who will lead and drive our growth. We aim to make the world a better, more connected place.  

  

CNN is looking for an SVP of Product Management & Design. This executive will be responsible for creating a premium and engaging customer experience for a suite of news subscription products and services on mobile and web. This person will be responsible for creating a long-term vision for CNN’s products; for functional excellence in both our product and design disciplines; and for managing trade-offs and for partnering across the company to drive user habituation and engagement.


This person will oversee a team of product managers in crafting innovative, user-centric solutions to customer problems, ensuring alignment with CNN’s broader strategic vision and business goals – and maintaining our commitment to deliver the highest of journalistic standards. By partnering deeply with news, features, video and more editorial teams, this person will leverage CNN’s competitive advantages and integrate them into a cutting-edge experience.


This person will be responsible for driving overall excellence of our digital products while adapting to evolving user behaviors and trends, championing a data-driven, customer-first approach to inform the features, roadmap, and ultimate product delivery.


The successful candidate will lead his/her team through CNN’s next chapter of transformation at a critical time for journalism, fostering a culture of creativity, innovation, and accountability while effectively managing with his/her proven capabilities in motivating and coaching a high performing team.

 **Your Role Accountabilities...**

* Define, drive, and execute a product roadmap and vision by identifying clear user needs that CNN can solve, and data and insights and turning them into actionable steps and aggressive deliverables for CNN’s experiences.
* Create alignment between editorial, engineering, business stakeholders, and leadership while helping to define the high-level product strategy that is aligned with CNN’s broader business goals and vision.
* Employ subject matter expertise (product, platform, industry trends) in news on both web and mobile app marketplaces from a deep understanding of customer motivations, journeys, and usage patterns.
* Build a content publishing and operations process that works daily with News/Advertising Sales to enhance content presentation, utilizing and testing existing features and functionality.
* Partner closely with growth capabilities in the Digital Products & Services organization to ensure tight alignment in strategy, prioritization, and resource allocation.
* Partner with Engineering, UX/Design, Business Intelligence, and editorial teams to understand current goals, and regularly experiment and design product solutions that incorporate user feedback through multiple iterations.
* Successfully track and act quickly and strategically based on key performance measures including: net promotor score, customer satisfaction, time on page and number of assets read, bounce rate, scroll depth, click-through rate (CTR), social shares, comments and interactions, subscription/newsletter signups, and return visitors.
* Drive the product organization to understand the desired user experience and work with the design team to create meaningful and relevant user experiences.
* Understand business considerations, the competitive landscape, and product development best practices to deliver strategic initiatives within a fast-paced, aggressive environment.
* Leverage WBD and external expertise around career laddering, functional capabilities to provide clear direction for career development and growth for the team
* Advocate and adjust to the right ratios of product, technology and design across the organization
* Build and manage a collaborative and high-performing team.

**Qualifications & Experience...**

* **Leadership**: You have 10+ years of successful progression with product related roles, preferably within the media industry. Demonstrated ability to communicate across the organization, and with/to the executive leadership team. Experience driving improvement and internal systems through functional design, development, and management of key capabilities that align with digital strategy and goals. The ability to lead change correlates to this leader’s ability to influence digital content owners to adopt and enhance their use of the system – championing innovative features and platform enhancements.
* **Growth:** You have deep experience with data-driven insights and performance to guide decision-making, leaning heavily on AI/ML tools to create efficiency and depth of understanding regarding user behavior and platform performance.
* **Strategy:** You have senior Product Management experience with a branded, subscription-based or member-based product or service where maximizing customer LTV requires diligent CRM, and delivering an ongoing superior user experience based on usability, value, and quality. Must know how to tailor both content and delivery, optimizing UI and UX to drive engagement and loyalty – done jointly with editorial and marketing teams which are primarily responsible for generating content, and acquisition and retention marketing.
* **People Management and Collaboration****:** You are a people manager with 10+ years of experience. You have an inclusive mindset. You can coach and motivate your team.
* **Execution:** You have managed complex work and delivered results on time. You are aggressive about your goals and have helped your team manage tradeoffs. You have collaborated cross functionally, working with other functions and squads to shared success. You are ruthlessly focused on delivering strategic, impactful work.
* The person must have experience building and managing high-performing teams in the past.

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $196,706.00 - $365,310.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

title: Member Services Representative
description:
The Member Services Representative will be responsible for creating a positive member experience by providing a superior level of customer service to Planet Fitness members, prospective members and guests.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Greet members, prospective members and guests, providing exceptional customer service.
* Handle all front desk related activities.
* Facilitate needed updates to member’s accounts.
* Respond to member questions and concerns in a timely and professional manner and elevate to Assistant Manager or Manager as needed.
* Assist in maintaining the neatness and cleanliness of the club.

 **Physical Demands**

* Continual standing and walking during shift.
* Continual talking in person or on the phone during shift.
* Must be able to occasionally lift up to 50 lbs.
* Will occasionally encounter toxic chemicals during shift.

**REQUIREMENTS**
----------------

* Customer service background preferred.
* Basic computer proficiency.
* A passion for fitness and health.
* Upbeat and positive attitude!
* Punctuality and reliability is a must.
* Exceptional customer service skills; able to interact in a positive and professional way with members and co-workers, exceeding the member’s expectations.
* Strong listener with the ability to empathize and problem solve.
* Demonstrate diplomacy in all interactions while using appropriate behavior and language.
* High School diploma/GED equivalent required.
* Must be 18 years of age or older.

  

Planet Fitness is an American franchise of fitness centers based in Newington, New Hampshire. Each gym features exercise equipment and fitness instructors to assist its members.
company_description: Planet Fitness created the Judgement Free Zone® because we believe anyone, of any fitness level, should feel accepted and respected when they walk into a gym.

title: Budtender/Cashier Role
description:
**Full Job Description**
------------------------

 **Position Title:** Budtender/Cashier

**Location:** Flōr de Fred, New York

**Reports To:** Store Manager

**Full-Time and Part-Time Positions Available**

 **Job Summary:**

**Flōr de Fred is seeking passionate and dedicated individuals to join our team as Budtenders/Cashiers. As a Budtender/Cashier, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service, maintaining the organization of the store, handling sales transactions, and staying informed about our diverse range of products. You will play a vital role in creating a welcoming and informative environment for our customers, ensuring their satisfaction and fostering loyalty.**

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* **Customer Service:** Provide excellent customer service before, during, and after the sales experience. Engage with customers in a friendly, knowledgeable, and professional manner to ensure their needs are met and to enhance their shopping experience.
* **Product Knowledge:** Develop and maintain comprehensive knowledge of all products in the store inventory. Attend ongoing product knowledge training sessions and stay updated on the latest trends and developments in the cannabis industry.
* **Sales Transactions:** Accurately handle all cash and electronic transactions at the register. Ensure that all sales are conducted in compliance with New York State cannabis regulations and Flōr de Fred’s operational standards.
* **Store Maintenance:** Maintain the organization and cleanliness of the store, ensuring that all displays are visually appealing and that the sales area is tidy and well-stocked.
* **Compliance:** Follow all operational rules, regulations, policies, and procedures, including those related to the sale of cannabis. Ensure that all transactions and customer interactions adhere to legal and company standards.
* **Customer Satisfaction:** Ensure the satisfaction of all customers throughout their retail experience, with a focus on increasing customer loyalty. Address customer inquiries and concerns promptly and effectively.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work collaboratively with team members and contribute to a positive work environment. Support your colleagues in achieving store goals and delivering a seamless customer experience.

**Qualifications:**

* Passion for cannabis.
* Confidence, dedication, and integrity are key qualities for successful candidates.
* Excellent conversational skills and a genuine interest in helping others.
* Minimum of 21 years of age.
* Prior retail or customer service experience is an asset but not required.
* Eagerness to grow and develop sales and customer service skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends.
* Must be able to lift at least 30 pounds.

**Benefits:**

* Full-time, part-time, and weekend positions available.
* Competitive hourly wage with opportunities for tips.
* Opportunities for career growth and development within the company.
* Ongoing training and education in cannabis products and industry trends.
* A supportive and inclusive work environment that values creativity and passion.

 **Why Join Flōr de Fred?**


Flōr de Fred is more than just a dispensary; we are a community-focused business dedicated to responsible cannabis consumption and the well-being of our customers. We offer a supportive and inclusive work environment where your passion for cannabis and customer service can thrive. Join us in making a positive impact on our community while growing your career in the cannabis industry.

title: Front of House Team-member Full Time Opening
description:
**We're looking for our next great Front of House Team Members!**

**If you, or someone you know,** ***ARE VACCINATED*****, looking for a dynamic organization and believe you're the person best able to meet the mission objectives, then this might be the opportunity for you. CURRENTLY HIRING FULL TIME ONLY.**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  

Brand New Location for one of the best "**Premium Fast Food**" restaurants in the country. Great location in Southeast Queens, easy to get to, and with tons of shopping choices in the same parking lot. **UFBG, d/b/a Chick-fil-A @ Five Towns**, exists ***“to elevate the human experience through service and leadership.”***

  

As a team member you are expected to embody our values ***(teamwork, humility, resilience, integrity & initiative, vulnerability, and excellence)*** as you execute our mission to ***“deliver delight through great food, exceptional experiences, and lasting positive impressions for both sides of the counter at all times.”***

  

For **Chick-fil-A @ Five Towns**, the Team Member role is more than just a job, it's an opportunity. In addition to working directly for an independent Operator, team members gain life experience that goes far beyond just serving a great product in a friendly environment. Chick-fil-A is a great opportunity for people of all ages and backgrounds, and no experience is necessary.

  

As a **FOH** (Front of House) Team Member, you will welcome & greet guests, take and prepare customer orders in either the front counter or drive-thru, maintain cleanliness in the counter and dining room, observe health and sanitation guidelines, and ensure each guest leaves with a smile! We are looking for friendly, enthusiastic people who enjoy serving customers. We will teach you everything else you need to know!

 **Committed, Coachable & Aware** are three core principles that we admire and respect in all team members.

 **Having a role at Chick-fil-A is about leveraging a stepping-stone to a successful future in the world of business. Here are some of the great benefits of working at Chick-fil-A:**

* **Flexible Hours** - You probably have commitments to your family, friends, school, or sports teams. We will try to arrange your work schedule around them.
* **Closed Sundays** - All Chick-fil-A restaurants are closed on Sundays so you can have a day off to spend with family and friends.
* **Work Directly with A Chick-fil-A Operator** - The Operator is an independent businessperson, responsible for the operation of the restaurant, who invests time in his or her employees, teaching them important business skills for the future.
* **Competitive Pay** - Along with a competitive paycheck, you will work in a nurturing environment where you will learn valuable business and people skills.
* **It's a Great Place to Work** - At Chick-fil-A, our Operators consider their team members to be more than just employees, they are a highly valued part of each Chick-fil-A restaurant. Our high retention rate is proof that team members really enjoy working at Chick-fil-A.

**REQUIREMENTS**
----------------

* Be able to work between 5:45am and 3:00pm
* Be 18 years of age or older
* Bilingual a Plus
* Be able to adhere to Chick-fil-A appearance guidelines
* Reading, writing, basic math and verbal communication skills required
* Must have a friendly, warm and welcoming personality
* Must be eligible to work in the United States
* Must have a source of reliable transportation
* Must be able to adapt quickly and work in a fast pace environment
* NYS Food Safety Prevention Certification a plus

  

In our kitchens, we focus on fresh and simple ingredients. And we always have. Since the beginning, we've served chicken that is whole breast meat, with no added fillers or hormones, and we bread it by hand in our restaurants. Produce is delivered fresh to our kitchens several times a week. Salads are chopped and prepared fresh throughout the day. Whole lemons are freshly squeezed in our restaurants and combined with pure cane sugar and water (yep, that’s all) to make Chick-fil-A Lemonade®. It may not be the easy way, but it's the only way we know.
company_description: Chick-fil-A, Inc. is the third largest quick-service restaurant company in the United States, known for its freshly-prepared food, signature hospitality and unique franchise model.

title: Veterinary Receptionist
description:
*Experienced veterinary receptionist*   
Park Animal Hospital is a growing two-doctor family owned and operated small animal veterinary hospital in the beautiful coastal town of Darien CT. We are looking for an energetic and experienced receptionist to join our hospital team. Good people skills, and good communication skills are required. We are a "paperless" practice, so good computer skills and experience with Avimark Veterinary Software is ideal. We are looking for someone who can work full time or part time.

A receptionist is responsible for working with our clients from the time they come to our facility, through their treatment plans and checking patients out. Responsibilities include but are not limited too: answering phones, helping customers in-person, scheduling appointments, cashiering, filing and smiling!

We are are professional vet hospital with a small town feel. If you would like to join our close nit group of caring professionals, please reply with a cover letter and your resume to be considered for an interview.

Minimum 1 year experience in a Veterinary Office is required. If you do not have experience working in a veterinary office you will not be considered for this position.

title: Wound Care Nurse - RN - Full Time
description:
Registered Nurse
  
  

At RestorixHealth, our mission is simple…to restore health and improve the quality of life – and access to care – for patients with wounds.
  
  

Our Wound Care Registered Nurses (will train) are the heart and soul behind what we do. Utilizing the Nursing Process, the RN plans, implements, directs, and evaluates patient care to achieve optimal outcomes. The Wound Care Nurse works collaboratively with all other disciplines on the assigned unit. Additionally, the RN prioritizes nursing actions and will implement physician orders accurately within appropriate time frames. Ongoing training will provide you with the tools to be successful in your role.
  
  

Take your passion for enhancing the lives of patients and turn it into a career, join the RestorixHealth Team and APPLY TODAY!
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

* Monday - Friday schedule, no weekends
* RestorixHealth is proud to provide employees with a comprehensive and attractive benefits program which includes the following:
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Health Savings Account (with employer match) and Flexible Spending Accounts (General Purpose, Limited Purpose, and Dependent Care)
* Employer-Paid Basic Life Insurance, AD&D and Short-Term Disability
* Voluntary Buy-Up Life Insurance (for self, spouse & children), Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
* Voluntary Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Plans
* Employee Assistance Program
* Pet Care Discount Program
* Generous Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
* 401(k) Retirement Plan (with employer match)
* Internal ongoing educational/training opportunities
* Competitive compensation
* Continuous coaching & mentorship


**What You’ll Do:**  

* Provide patient care based on scientific principles/nursing theory and evidence-based practice
* Recognize change in the patient’s condition and intervene appropriately
* Prioritize nursing actions including reflecting patient needs, acuity, and desired outcomes
* Implement physician orders accurately within appropriate time frames
* Educate and counsel patients and their families on wound care processes and issues


**Qualifications:**  

* Associate degree in nursing, Bachelor of Science in Nursing required for Magnet Hospitals
* Valid Registered Nursing license required
* Valid CPR certification from the American Heart Association required
* Prior experience working with wound care patients (Will train)
* Prior experience with billing and coding preferred


At RestorixHealth, we grow talent. When you join our team, you have the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths and potential, including the possibility to move functionally, geographically, laterally, and vertically. This is a career destination for engaged, caring, passionate and talented people who want to make a difference. We are the leader in the development and management of comprehensive wound healing and Amputation Prevention Center facilities.
  
  

RestorixHealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, or marital status.
company_addresses: 3445 North Causeway Boulevard Suite 600 Metairie, LA 70002
company_description: RestorixHealth has become the nation’s leading wound care solutions company providing services, programs and products across the entire wound care continuum.

title: Wound Care LPN-HBO Tech - Full Time
description:
Full Time Licensed Practical Nurse / HBO Technician
  
  

At RestorixHealth, our mission is simple…to restore health and improve the quality of life!
  
  

We are looking for a dedicated Licensed Practical Nurse / HBO Technician (will train) to provide Wound Care and Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy to our referred patients. This technician conducts initial and ongoing age-specific assessments in designated time frames and provides therapy and hyperbaric chamber operations. The ideal Nurse works collaboratively with all other disciplines at assigned unit as well as uses the “nursing process” to plan, implement, and evaluate patient care to achieve ideal patient outcomes. Ongoing training will provide you the tools to be successful in your role.
  
  

Take your passion for enhancing the lives of patient and turn it into a career, join the RestorixHealth Team and APPLY TODAY!
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

* Monday – Friday schedule, no weekends
* Comprehensive benefits package (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, 401k)
* Career Pathways to Wound Care and Hyperbaric Certification
* Generous paid time off
* Internal ongoing educational opportunities


**What You’ll Do:**  

* Preparation of all patients referred for treatment
* Participates in department’s quality improvement plan and assists in collecting data used for Quality Assurance & Education
* Document all care provided accurately & completely according to hospital and department policy
* Provide therapy and hyperbaric chamber operations and maintenance/cleaning as required
* Recognize change in the patient’s condition and intervene appropriately

**Qualifications:**  

* Must have a valid and current BLS from the American Heart Association
* Valid CPR certification from the American Heart Association required
* Emergency Medical Technician (EMT-B, EMT-I, EMT-CC, EMT-P), Registered Nurse (RN) or Licensed Practical/Vocational Nurse (LVN/LPN) certification in the state in which the Technician will work. Other advanced medical certifications will be considered.
* CHT trained/certified preferred
* Prior experience with wound care patients preferred (Will train)
* Basic skills in Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, Outlook)
* Prior experience with an Electronic Medical Records (EMR) system preferred
* Must be physically able to perform CPR


At RestorixHealth, we grow talent. This is a career destination for engaged, caring, passionate and talented people who want to make a difference. We are the leader in the development and management of comprehensive wound healing and Amputation Prevention Center facilities.

title: Visual Merchandiser
description:
Job Title: Contract/Part-Time Visual Merchandiser and Designer

Location: Various Studios in NYC

Founded in 2007, Club Pilates is the largest Pilates brand by number of studios, designed with the vision of making Pilates more accessible, approachable and welcoming to everyone. Club Pilates offers extensive training certification for its instructors. Its 500-hour training program includes instruction on Pilates, barre, Triggerpoint, and TRX Suspension Trainers.

A local multi-unit ownership group is looking for a talented Part-Time Visual Merchandiser to join our team and help elevate our brand's visual retail displays, windows, and more.

**Overview**  
As a Contract/Part-Time Visual Merchandiser, you will work closely with our management team to produce visually appealing window displays and retail walls that showcase our brand identity and messaging. This role requires a creative individual with a strong eye for aesthetics and detail, capable of producing upscale, fitness-oriented displays in-studio and across TV displays.

**Duties**  
- Design and set up visual displays in accordance with company guidelines  
- Utilize interior design principles to create eye-catching product arrangements  
- Collaborate with the management team to ensure merchandise is effectively showcased  
- Design and produce quarterly theme/season display changes  
- Revise based on feedback from team members and stakeholders  
- Maintain store aesthetics by regularly updating retail displays and signage  
- Stay updated with design trends and tools to keep our visual content fresh and innovative

**Experience**  
- Proven experience in visual merchandising, preferably in a fitness-oriented retail setting  
- Strong understanding of retail sales principles and techniques  
- Proficiency in design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and other relevant tools  
- Strong portfolio showcasing a variety of design projects and styles  
- Excellent understanding of color theory, typography, and layout principles  
- Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously  
- Strong communication skills and the ability to take constructive feedback  
- Excellent time management skills to meet deadlines efficiently

If you are passionate about creating captivating visual experiences and driving sales through innovative displays, and interested in partnering with a dynamic multi-unit ownership group we invite you to apply for the Visual Merchandiser position with us.

Please submit your resume and your portfolio or work samples.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $17.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 5 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Store discount

Ability to Commute:

* Manhattan, NY 10018 (Required)

Work Location: In person
company_addresses: 17877 Von Karman Ave, Suite 100 Irvine, CA 92614
company_description: We believe Pilates is the finest strength-training workout available for anyone, at any age. It’s a path to a fuller, more satisfying life!

title: TEACHER ASSISTANT/FLOATER
description:
**Assistant Teacher**

title: Retail Warehouse Associate
description:
As a Retail Warehouse Associate, you’ll be part of an energetic and efficient team that’s dedicated to delivering tech products from the store’s warehouse to our customers when, where and how they need them. You’ll retrieve and ship products, restock shelves and take inventory to ensure a great shopping experience. When the situation calls for it, you’ll also directly assist customers and collaborate with other employees on the sales floor.  

  

**What you’ll do*** Unload trucks and record store inventory
* Prepare products to be shipped to other stores and costumers’ homes
* Stock shelves and organize merchandise displays to help customers see what’s possible and quickly purchase products
* Follow established safety guidelines while operating store equipment
* Replenish products daily to ensure they’re fully stocked on the sales floor
* Process online orders and assist other employees with store pickup orders

**Basic qualifications*** Working and thriving in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Working a flexible schedule that matches your availability (weekends, nights, holidays, etc.)
* Moving up to 100 pounds with or without accommodation

**What’s in it for you**  

  

We’re committed to helping our people thrive at work and at home. We offer generous benefits that address your total well-being and provide support as you need it, especially key moments in your life.  

  

Our benefits include:* Competitive pay
* Generous employee discount
* Financial savings and retirement resources
* Support for your physical and mental well-being

**About us**  

  

As part of the Best Buy team, you’ll help us fulfill our purpose to enrich lives through technology. We bring that to life every day by humanizing and personalizing tech solutions for every stage of life — in our stores, online and in customers’ homes.  

  

Our culture is built on deeply supporting and valuing our amazing employees who make it all possible. We’re committed to being a great place to work, where you can unlock unique career possibilities. Above all, we aim to provide a place where you can bring your full, authentic self to work now and into the future. Tomorrow works here.™  

Best Buy is an equal opportunity employer.  

  

**Application deadline:** Minimum of 5 days from the posting date. You can find that date above the job title at the top of the page.
company_description: Best Buy is a leading provider of technology products, services and solutions.

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
As a Retail Sales Associate, you’ll be the face of Best Buy for everyone who visits our stores. We’ll train you with the skills and knowledge you need to confidently recommend the right tech products and solutions for each customer. By creating a great shopping experience and inspiring people with what’s possible, you’ll help us enrich lives through technology.  

  

**What you’ll do*** Welcome and engage with customers in a warm, friendly manner
* Serve as a brand ambassador by bringing together your passion for people and technology to serve our customers
* Recommend products and solutions that meet customers’ needs
* Complete cashier duties for purchases, returns and exchanges
* Apply the appropriate knowledge and expertise through ongoing learning and development
* Ensure your department is clean and well stocked

**Basic qualifications*** Working and thriving in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Working a flexible schedule that matches your availability (weekends, nights, holidays, etc.)

**What’s in it for you**  

  

We’re committed to helping our people thrive at work and at home. We offer generous benefits that address your total well-being and provide support as you need it, especially key moments in your life.  

  

Our benefits include:* Competitive pay
* Generous employee discount
* Financial savings and retirement resources
* Support for your physical and mental well-being

**About us**  

  

As part of the Best Buy team, you’ll help us fulfill our purpose to enrich lives through technology. We bring that to life every day by humanizing and personalizing tech solutions for every stage of life — in our stores, online and in customers’ homes.  

  

Our culture is built on deeply supporting and valuing our amazing employees who make it all possible. We’re committed to being a great place to work, where you can unlock unique career possibilities. Above all, we aim to provide a place where you can bring your full, authentic self to work now and into the future. Tomorrow works here.™  

Best Buy is an equal opportunity employer.  

  

**Application deadline:** Minimum of 5 days from the posting date. You can find that date above the job title at the top of the page.
company_description: Best Buy is a leading provider of technology products, services and solutions.

title: Housekeeper Room Care
description:
Are you ready to begin your journey with Concord; a company who believes in and who supports career advancement opportunities for its associates? If so, we may have the perfect position for you!


**Concord Hospitality is hiring Housekeepers!**

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Cleaning and servicing assigned guest rooms in a timely and organized manner, following procedures and hotel standards.
* Keeping an organized linen cart that is neat, well stocked and organized.
* Report any areas within guest rooms that need attention, such as fixtures, door locks, televisions, HVAC, etc.
* Maintaining security of your equipment, key and supplies issued to you.
* Reporting lost and found articles to your supervisor.
* Respond to guest requests in a friendly and timely manner.


Concord Hospitality has a great work culture, and our associates are our greatest assets. Full-time associates receive competitive pay and great benefits.

  



¿Estás listo para comenzar un camino con Concord? ¿Una empresa que cree en las oportunidades de desarrollo profesional de sus asociados y las apoya? Si es así, ¡podemos tener la posición perfecta para ti!


**Concord Hospitality está contratando amas de llaves!**


**Responsabilidades:**


* Limpiar y dar servicio a las habitaciones asignadas de manera oportuna y organizada, siguiendo los procedimientos y estándares del hotel.
* Mantener un carrito de lino organizado que esté limpio, bien abastecido y organizado.
* Informe cualquier área dentro de las habitaciones que necesite atención, como accesorios, cerraduras de puertas, televisores, HVAC, etc.
* Mantener la seguridad de su equipo, llaves y suministros que se le entreguen.
* Informar artículos perdidos y encontrados a su supervisor.
* Responda a las solicitudes de los huéspedes de manera amistosa y oportuna.


Concord Hospitality tiene una gran cultura de trabajo y nuestros asociados son nuestro mayor activo. Los asociados de tiempo completo reciben un salario competitivo y grandes beneficios.

  



Si está buscando un trabajo en el que se sienta valorado y reconocido por su arduo trabajo, solicite en línea a Concord Hospitality.

title: Fitness Trainer
description:
The Fitness Trainer will be responsible for running the Planet Fitness group fitness program (PE@PF). This includes assisting new members in the achievement of their fitness goals by designing a simple workout program and instructing them on the proper use of equipment.

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Conduct and run the Planet Fitness PE@PF program, including creating and following the schedule.
* Consult with members regarding their fitness goals and instruct them on how to properly and safely use the equipment.
* Create bi-weekly updates consisting of a variety of exercises.
* Meet class requirements based on club size and member traffic.
* Assist in front desk related activities including:
* Respond to member questions and concerns in a timely and professional manner and elevate to Assistant Manager or Manager as needed.

**REQUIREMENTS**
----------------

* A passion for fitness and health!
* Upbeat and positive attitude.
* Punctuality and reliability is a must.
* Exceptional customer service skills; able to interact in a positive and professional way with members and co-workers, exceeding the member’s expectations.
* Strong listener with the ability to empathize and problem solve.
* Demonstrate diplomacy in all interactions while using appropriate behavior and language.
* Current CPR Certification required.
* Nationally Certified Training Certificate required.
* High School diploma/GED equivalent required.
* Must be 18 years of age or older.

  

Planet Fitness is an American franchise of fitness centers based in Newington, New Hampshire. Each gym features exercise equipment and fitness instructors to assist its members.
company_description: Planet Fitness created the Judgement Free Zone® because we believe anyone, of any fitness level, should feel accepted and respected when they walk into a gym.

title: Property Accountant - Affordable Housing
description:
Property Accountant
  
Paths is a full-scale, vertically integrated affordable housing developer, builder, and operator. Since 2004, the Paths team created and preserved high-quality affordable housing across the U.S. that enhances communities and helps residents build better lives. With over 12,000 units across 10 states under management and more than 400 employees, Paths manages a suite of capabilities spanning the entire property life-cycle, including: development, construction, property management, maintenance, and security.
  
  

**Summary/Objective:**  

Reporting to the Property Accountant Manager, the Property Accountant will have full responsibility for managing the day to day accounting practices for the assigned portfolio.
  
  

**Classification:** Exempt
  
Hybrid schedule – 3 days in office/2 days work from home
  
**Essential function/Responsibilities:** duties include but are not limited to the following
  
* Reconcile bank statements monthly.
* Journalize various expenses monthly.
* Review the general ledger for inaccuracies monthly.
* Ensure subsidiary ledgers match the trial balance.
* Produce monthly reports.
* Process security deposits.
* Enter adjusting journal entries.
* Assist with year-end close and audit preparation.
* Oversees payroll processes
* Guides accounting team members on various task and inquiries


**Requirements:**  

* Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting
* 5+ years of accounting experience within the real estate industry; residential/affordable experience preferred, commercial a plus.
* Working knowledge of Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable
* Must be proficient Microsoft applications - Word and Excel
* Prefer a working knowledge of Yardi Voyager software
* Strong organization skills
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team
* Self-starter who is willing to take initiative on tasks
* Superior Customer Service skills required
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work efficiently
* Strong capability to communicate effectively both verbally and written, including giving and receiving feedback with all levels within the organization
* Ability to perform at high levels in a fast paced, ever-changing work environment


**Salary Range:** $80,000 - 85,000 annually
  
  

**Benefits:**  

* We pay 100% of medical benefits, for employee only. Dental, vision and additional benefit selections plan options also available.
* 401 (K) available plus company match
* Paid Time Off & Holidays
* Commuter Benefits
* STD, LTD, life insurance, dependent coverage


Paths Management Services LLC is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in employment based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, disability, political affiliation or belief.

title: Showroom Assistant - Women's Apparel
description:
SHOWROOM ASSISTANT

We are an established women's apparel designer/manufacturer/wholesaler that is looking for a highly motivated, hardworking and organized individual to join our team. The individual will be primarily responsible for preparing samples for the showroom, but will have the opportunity to learn other aspects of the business and potentially grow into other areas within the company.

Responsibilities

* Keep all showroom and shipment samples steamed, tagged, and organized
* Photograph and track samples and prints that are sent out to buyer meetings
* Prepare photo packages to send to buyer meetings
* Cut fabric swatches and prepare color cards to send to buyers
* Catalog and organize prior season samples in storage
* Pull and prepare samples for buyer meetings
* Take stock of office supplies for reorder
* Bag and box old samples for donation/discard in storage
* Will be required to pick up and drop off samples at external locations on occasion
* Return samples to stores both in person and through mail
* Administrative filing and organizing
* General support in other areas as needed

Qualifications

* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Energetic and hard working
* Proficiency in MS Office Products - Excel, Word, Outlook

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $45,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Chick-fil-A Kitchen / BOH Team Leader
description:
**Chick-fil-A Kitchen / BOH Team Leader**


Chick-fil-A South Plainfield, NJ

  

Chick-fil-A South Plainfield is hiring a growing professional who wants to acquire leadership skills, build their career portfolio, and have the opportunity to grow within the company. Chick-fil-A was voted as America’s favorite quick-service restaurant, and we pride ourselves on having a fast-paced growth culture where leaders are continually developing and enhancing their skills and the skills of those around them. This includes high-level hospitality experience, business acumen, coaching, and overall leadership abilities.


Being our Kitchen / BOH Team Leader gives you the unique opportunity to start on a path to management and acquire management responsibilities gradually, with the end goal being a position in senior management at our restaurant. The position requires you to work fast-paced in our high volume store. Team Leader helps to train and oversee the back-of-house employees, and reports to the Manager in Charge for each shift.

**Pay Type:** Starting at $16.50/hr

**Position Type:**

* Full-Time
* Open Availability Preferred

**Our Benefits:**

* Flexible Schedules
* Meal Stipend
* Access to Scholarships at up to $2,500 per year
* Professional Development with Leadership Development
* Gain additional experience in Talent, Operations, Marketing
* Certifications (such as Food Manager, Certified Trainer, etc).
* Training through books/videos/blended learning
* Customized individual development plan based on your goals
* Performance management and reviews
* Mock interviews and interview coaching
* One-on-one coaching from Managers and our Operator
* Fun, Fast-Paced, Hard-Working Environment
* Work for Independent Operator who is invested in your success
* Sunday’s Off

 **Requirements:**

* Must be 18 or older
* Must have prior experience kitchen or production, or a relatable field
* Must have open availability
* Proven ability to lead a team
* Basic computer and iPad competency
* Must be able to meet the physical demands of the position which includes, but is not limited to, standing for up to 10 hours and lifting up to 50lbs
* Team-oriented, adaptable, dependable, and strong work ethic
* Strong desire to serve customers and the team
* Must be an excellent coach, communicator and team builder

 **Responsibilities:**

* Ensures that the shifts are running smoothly in the kitchen
* Communicates employee performance and policy/procedure violations to the Shift Manager
* Trains new Kitchen Team Members and follows up to ensure they’re equipped for success
* Understands food safety protocols and quality standards for all products in the kitchen
* Performs daily cleanliness checks for the thawing cabinets, breading table, walk-in cooler, freezers, floors, etc.
* Assists with inventory management, and ensures the products are being rotated using the FIFO principle
* Complete understanding of each key position in the back of the store
* Demonstrate knowledge of the brand and menu items
* Maintain regular and consistent attendance and punctuality
* Follow Chick-fil-A’s operational policies and procedures

  

Thank you for your interest in employment at Chick-fil-A South Plainfield! Upon submitting your resume, you’ll be contacted via phone call or email within 1-3 business days. Please do not contact the store.

**REQUIREMENTS**
----------------
company_description: Chick-fil-A, Inc. is the third largest quick-service restaurant company in the United States, known for its freshly-prepared food, signature hospitality and unique franchise model.

title: Office Administrative Assistant
description:
**Administrative Assistant for Christian Nonprofit Ministry**

**About Us:**   
Join a dynamic Christian nonprofit organization ministry that is dedicated to touching the lives of multitudes through support, compassion, and the Gospel. We are a vibrant and mission-driven organization where your work has a profound impact on the community and beyond.

**Position Overview:**   
We are seeking an organized and cheerful Administrative Assistant to join our team. In this role, you will assist our leadership with a variety of office tasks, manage database entries, and ensure smooth day-to-day operations. If you are passionate about ministry, have a heart for service, and possess excellent multitasking and communication skills, we would love to hear from you!

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Database entry with accuracy and attention to detail.
* Handle multiple tasks simultaneously, meet deadlines, and work efficiently under pressure.
* Deliver excellent customer service skills both written and verbal.
* Maintain consistency, organization, and integrity in all duties and responsibilities.

**Qualifications:**

* A cheerful and positive attitude.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks.
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and basic computer knowledge.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Experience in a similar administrative role is preferred.
* A heart for ministry and a passion for serving others.

**How to Apply:** Please send us your resume along with references and a cover letter telling us about your personal testimony and why you feel called to work in a church ministry nonprofit. Share your relevant experience and how it aligns with our mission.

**Join us in making a difference in the lives of many by supporting our ministry and spreading the Gospel. We look forward to hearing from you!**

title: Network Data Management Jr. Data Analyst
description:
Centers Plan for Healthy Living's goal is to create the ultimate healthcare experience that provides our members, their families, healthcare decision makers, and general caregivers with the guidance and plans they need for healthy living.
  
  

**JOB SUMMARY:**  

Responsible for ensuring operational effectiveness through critical analysis and reconciliation of data gathered from multiple sources and creating timely reports in all aspects of the Network/Provider Operations Departments. This position requires someone with strong analytic skills, ability to gather business requirements, craft data into usable reports, track and trend issues, and provide feedback on solutions.
  
  

**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Analyze incoming requests, identify issues, determine root causes, and participate in the development of solutions.
* Work with various applications and cross-referencing data.
* Report reconciliation, development, and presentation on a timely basis.
* Participate in standing meetings as necessary, providing the data necessary for such meetings.
* Liaison with various stakeholders to solve applicable issues or answer inquires.
* Collaborate with other Business, Data, or System Analysts and/or Project Managers in the execution of various projects.
* Perform other duties and special projects as assigned.


**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**  

Education
  
  

**Required:** College degree in related area (computer science, health sciences, business administration)
  
  

Specific Technical Skills
  
  

**Required:** Proficiency with MS applications, including but not limited to Word, Excel, Outlook, Power Point, and Access
  
  

**Knowledge and Skills:**  

* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management
* Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Effective analytical skills.
* Knowledge of medical, claims and provider contracting/credentialing systems.


**Preferred:**  

Strong knowledge of financial, data base systems, and other applications.
  
  

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**  

The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
* Able to operate computer equipment
* Able to communicate by phone and in writing


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to the job classification. They should not be constructed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required.
  
  

Centers Plan For Healthy Living is committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences of our workforce to create opportunities for our employees and our business. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law and will not be denied employment.

title: Registered Nurse
company: Central Nassau Guidance and Counseling Services
description:
**JOB DEFINITION:**


Work with the CN Guidance Youth ACT Team to deliver services to those individuals and their identified families who are diagnosed with severe emotional disturbance (SED) and whose needs have not been met by more traditional service delivery approaches.

 **EDUCATION REQUIRED:**


Must be currently licensed as a Registered Nurse by the New York State Department of Education and possess either an Associate's Degree, Bachelor's Degree and/or Master's Degree in Nursing from an accredited program\\*. Bachelor's or Master's Degree preferred.

 **EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:**


One (1) year of community mental health experience and/or at least two (2) years of mental health experience specifically working in a mental health setting.  



  

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Responsible for the coordination of client services to include scheduling of outside clinic appointments, lab appointments, obtaining random urine analysis (UA) and intramuscular (IM) administration.

  

* Ensures the completion of all medical assessments for each client, including coordinating additional services with the psychiatrist.

  

* Collaborates with the psychiatrist in the coordination of care for clients to include clinical and educational training of the team as needed; development, maintenance and supervision of all medication administration efforts; supervision of all psychiatric and medical treatment and/or medical interventions.

  

* Monitors the pharmacological effects of prescribed psychotropic medications and notifies the psychiatrist of their reported effectiveness.

  

* Working in conjunction with the Psychiatrist and Team Leader, is responsible for the coordination of patient education efforts to include the benefits, risks and possible side effects of prescribed medication. This education effort is not limited to home visits but may also include the coordination of various groups to include but not limited to, medication, wellness, etc.

  

Monitors the client's medication regimen to ensure completeness and accuracy in the provision of care. Coordinate the receipt and delivery of medications with the pharmacy. Prepackage weekly medications, facilitate prior authorizations and patient assistance forms for medications as needed.  

* 

  

* Assists the psychiatrist by scheduling clients for visits based upon client needs, s/p hospitalization and/or incarceration. The RN will also advise the psychiatrist of all medication renewal needs.

  

* Must be available (along with other members of the Youth ACT Team) on an as needed basis twenty-four (24) hours a day, seven (7) days a week, including responsibility for periodic pager coverage.

  

Responsible for entering the documentation for each client visit in the Electronic Health Record as instructed by the team leader within twenty-four (24) hours after the client visit.  

* 

  

* Facilitate sharing of data with the individuals to whom it applies to facilitate partnered decision-making and to keep clients informed of progress

  

* Complete QI Training during onboarding and participate in QI refresher training as needed.

  

* Actively engage in agency wide training and work groups as well as NYS specific training on and for the Youth ACT model.
* identify and implement quality improvement trainings and activities as part of professional development goals
* Encourage quality improvement processes and provide consistent resources for QI and professional development
* Ability to cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views and experiences. A Culture that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better business results.
* Adherence to all safety protocols and procedures to ensure a safe working environment for all employees. Demonstrate a commitment to maintaining a safe work environment by following established safety guidelines.
* Other duties and assignments as requested by the Team Leader and Nursing Supervisor
* **BENEFITS:**


We offer an attractive and competitive benefits package for full time employees which includes but not limited to:


	+ Medical
	+ Dental
	+ Vision
	+ $0 Deductible Platinum Plus Medical Insurance Plan - 90% Employer Provided Benefit
	+ Flexible Spending Account
	+ 403(b) retirement plan
	+ Long Term and Short Term Disability
	+ Legal Plan
	+ Dependent Care Expense Account
	+ Life Insurance/Supplemental Life Insurance
	+ Pet Insurance
	+ HRA
	+ Training programs including a Mentorship program
	+ Employees may be eligible for Federal/Public Student Loan Forgiveness
	+ Career growth and Promotional opportunities
	+ Employee Perks and Discounts to Broadway shows and more
5 Personal Days, 10-20 Vacation Days, 12 Sick Days, 12 Company Paid Holidays-yearly and so much more.

Experience working with adults diagnosed with mental illness and facilitating groups preferred.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Managing a caseload of 5-15 clients, which includes (but is not limited to) the following:
	+ Conduct required assessments for new clients and on an ongoing basis with existing clients
	+ Develop treatment plans in collaboration with recipients; review and update as required
	+ Meet individually with clients to address progress/barriers toward treatment goals
	+ Maintain contact with collaterals to coordinate care/treatment of clients

	+ Utilize evidence-based materials when facilitating groups

* Work with the entire CN Guidance team to embrace the continuous quality improvement approach to address systemic, organizational changes, and improve client care.
* Complete trainings as required by the agency during onboarding, annually, and as needed; complete program-specific trainings related to further developing skills for career growth and optimizing client care.
* Facilitate sharing of data with the individuals to whom it applies to facilitate partnered decision-making and to keep clients informed of progress
* Complete QI Training during onboarding and participate in QI refresher training as needed.
* identify and implement quality improvement trainings and activities as part of professional development goals
* Encourage quality improvement processes and provide consistent resources for QI and professional development
* Ability to cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views and experiences. A Culture that makes better decisions, drives innovation, and delivers better business results.
* Adherence to all safety protocols and procedures to ensure a safe working environment for all employees. Demonstrate a commitment to maintaining a safe work environment by following established safety guidelines.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**BENEFITS:**


We offer an attractive and competitive benefits package for full time employees which includes but not limited to:

* Medical

5 Personal Days, 10-20 Vacation Days, 12 Sick Days, 12 Company Paid Holidays-yearly and so much more.

title: White Plains - School Bus Road Supervisor
description:
**WeDriveU** is the leader in shared mobility solutions that connect communities, campuses, and workplaces. WeDriveU operates private shuttle and public transit systems across the U.S serving millions of passenger journeys a year. The company's 4,000+ team members operate 2,300 vehicles across 46 U.S. locations, providing safe, reliable and sustainable options as part of a global family of brands serving more than 1B bus and rail passengers on four continents. Visit www.wedriveu.com.

 **Job Description:**



The Road Supervisor will report to the General Manager and is responsible for actively facilitating communications between the field operations team to ensure the service is running efficiently.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Supervises day-to-day activities of operators to ensure compliance with operational requirements for safe bus operations including compliance with corporate safety training processes and practices
* Provides support, advice and guidance to operators in responding to a variety of issues (e.g. customer complaints, bus and/or worker safety, time-off requests), assessing situations and determining appropriate course of action (e.g. additional training, counseling) to prevent further occurrences in the future
* Ensures a positive work environment for operators by providing coaching, mentoring and non-safety related training to promote high employee motivation and morale and commitment to company values and excellence in customer service
* Monitors on-time performance
* Prepares and submits required reports in a timely manner
* Supervises compliance with Company policies and/or processes by action and speech; discusses any breech of policy and procedure noted with Operations Manager
* Collects and audits employee DVIs
* Evaluates the performance of all direct-report personnel on a regular basis according to company policy
* Administers appropriate employee discipline as necessary

 **Skills Required and Physical Demands:**


* Ability to multitask and pay extreme attention to detail.
* Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize and problem solve.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite with intermediate to advanced excel skills.
* Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills
* Excellent customer service skills
* Able to lift 25+ pounds, climb stairs, and be on your feet for an extended period.
* Additional skills and physical demands may apply.

 **Education and Qualifications:**



Hard requirements:


* Minimum of 5+ years of experience in Operations Management with 3 years in transit industry preferred; college education can be substituted for up to 2 years required work experience



Preferred requirements:


* Experience in public or private alternative transportation demand management (TDM)
* Commercial driver’s license
* Knowledge of DMV policies and procedures

 **EEOC**



WeDriveU is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
